titleStmt.title: Englands deplorable condition shewing the common-wealths malady, by [brace] sacriledge, and want of duty in the people, contention, want of charity in the ministery, perjury, and want of truth in both : and its remedy by [brace] the peoples obedience and liberality, the ministers love and unity, both their repentance and fidelity : briefly declar'd in three treatises of [brace] the ministers patrimony and peoples duty, proposals to reconcile such as are for lordly episcopacy and un-ordain'd presbytery, for popular independancy and upstart antipædobaptistry, and against perjury : also, a petition for the Jews.
titleStmt.author: E. F.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for the author, and are to be sold by Richard Skelton ...,

notesStmt.note: Proposes Congregationalism as a solution to the church-government dispute.
Imperfect: pages faded, stained and tightly bound with slight loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
